page.title: 15Then & Now- life in 1925 (3)
page.content: It all depended how well off you were. If you were very poor as we were in those days if there was an old pair that anybody didn't want you'd wear them; that's the only glasses{we}had. I've known my Mother many times pick up anybody else's glasses and try to see what she wants to see with them. Couldn't afford any glasses. {Did you wear lipstick? No! My! Never heard of that in our days. Lipstick! But I'll tell you what we used to do if we were going out. As I said we'd have a little bit of powder to put around our face and a little bit of rouge. I don't know if you know what rouge is, it came in a little box, it's a red powder. {Did you have your ears pierced? No, didn't have ears pierced. {Did you have a bike? No.
